p: In the work of Compagnone et al. [ 19], the EO from the leaves of C. matourensis caused cytotoxicity in LoVo (human colon carcinoma) and HeLa (human cervical cancer) cell lines with IC 50 values of 36.6 and 83.9 μg/mL, respectively, while inducing cytotoxicity in human dermis fibroblasts cells with an IC 50 value of 132.7 μg/mL. In this work, we observed similar results where the EO was cytotoxic with IC 50 values of 23.3 µg/mL for MCF-7, 28.9 µg/mL for HCT116, 28.5 µg/mL for HepG2, 17.8 µg/mL for HL-60, and 25.8 µg/mL for MRC-5.
